case_vignette: A 35-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 1-month history of double vision, difficulty climbing stairs, and weakness when trying to brush her hair. She reports that these symptoms are worse after she exercises and disappear after she rests for a few hours. Physical examination shows drooping of her right upper eyelid that worsens when the patient is asked to gaze at the ceiling for 2 minutes. There is diminished motor strength in the upper extremities. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing double vision, trouble going up stairs, and feeling weak when I try to brush my hair.
What is your age and sex?
I am a 35-year-old woman.
Have these symptoms been constant or do they get better and worse throughout the day?
These symptoms get worse after exercise and improve after I rest for a few hours.
Have you experienced any issues with facial expression, like difficulty smiling or drooping eyelids?
Yes, I have noticed that my right upper eyelid is drooping.
Do you have any difficulty swallowing or changes in your speaking voice?
No, I haven't had any trouble with swallowing or changes in my speaking voice.
Do you have any family history of neurological disorders?
The case vignette does not provide information about my family history, so I can't answer that.
Have you experienced any muscle weakness or other symptoms elsewhere in your body?
I have diminished strength in my upper extremities.
Have you been on any medication recently or have you had any infections?
The case vignette doesn't mention any recent medications or infections that I have had.
Final Diagnosis: Myasthenia gravis.
